leaf_cluster.leaf_cluster_name: 材料-实验合成与表征自动化生态
leaf_cluster.task_chain: 采集→计划→执行→记录→复现/审计
leaf_cluster.tool_form: LIMS/设备接口 + 闭环平台

tools.name: MADSci
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Autonomous Discovery for Science Framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed to facilitate modular autonomous discovery in scientific laboratories, enabling the orchestration of hardware and software components for self-driving labs.

tools.name: WEI
tools.one_line_profile: Workcell Execution Interface for Autonomous Discovery
tools.detailed_description: The Workcell Execution Interface (WEI) provides a standard interface for executing workflows in autonomous discovery and self-driving laboratories, managing the communication between high-level planners and low-level hardware.

tools.name: ARES OS
tools.one_line_profile: Operating system for closed-loop autonomous experimentation
tools.detailed_description: Research software developed by AFRL to streamline the creation and management of systems for closed-loop, autonomous experimentation in materials science and chemistry.

tools.name: Gremlin
tools.one_line_profile: Active learning for high-throughput synthesis of metal oxides
tools.detailed_description: A tool for active learning guided high-throughput synthesis and characterization, specifically applied to mixed metal oxides discovery.

tools.name: StrideLengthEstimation
tools.one_line_profile: Pedestrian stride length estimation benchmark and software
tools.detailed_description: A benchmark dataset and sampling software for estimating pedestrian stride length using smartphone sensors and FM-INS modules, useful for biomechanics and navigation research.

tools.name: AutoRA
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Research Assistant framework
tools.detailed_description: A framework for automating the scientific research process, including experimental design, data collection, and model discovery, enabling closed-loop scientific inquiry.

tools.name: MAPz_at_BAM
tools.one_line_profile: Materials Acceleration Platform configuration for BAM
tools.detailed_description: Software and configuration resources for the Materials Acceleration Platform (MAP) at the Bundesanstalt für Materialforschung und -prüfung (BAM), supporting automated materials research.

tools.name: Hyperion
tools.one_line_profile: Unattended data collection for synchrotrons using BlueSky
tools.detailed_description: A tool for unattended data collection at Diamond Light Source, built upon the BlueSky and Ophyd frameworks for experimental control.

tools.name: LLMatDesign
tools.one_line_profile: Autonomous materials discovery using LLMs
tools.detailed_description: A framework leveraging Large Language Models for autonomous materials discovery and design, enabling AI-driven exploration of material spaces.

tools.name: AI-Researcher
tools.one_line_profile: Autonomous agent for scientific innovation and research
tools.detailed_description: An autonomous AI agent designed to conduct scientific research, capable of formulating hypotheses, planning experiments, and analyzing results to drive scientific innovation.

tools.name: ADO
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for executing computational experiments and benchmarks
tools.detailed_description: An extendible framework developed by IBM for executing benchmarks and computational experiments at scale, supporting optimization and discovery workflows.

tools.name: Chemosensitivity
tools.one_line_profile: Predicting chemosensitivity from gene expression data
tools.detailed_description: A tool for predicting the chemosensitivity of cells based on gene expression profiles, aiding in pharmacogenomics and personalized medicine research.

tools.name: MechWolf
tools.one_line_profile: Python library for robotic flow chemistry and lab automation
tools.detailed_description: MechWolf is designed to make robotic chemistry accessible by providing a software interface for controlling flow chemistry apparatus and automating experiments.

tools.name: Achilles
tools.one_line_profile: Descriptive statistics and characterization for OMOP CDM databases
tools.detailed_description: Achilles provides automated characterization of health information for large-scale longitudinal evidence systems, generating descriptive statistics and data quality reports for OMOP Common Data Model databases.

tools.name: PLACE
tools.one_line_profile: Python package for laboratory automation, control, and experimentation
tools.detailed_description: PLACE (Python Laboratory Automation Control and Experimentation) is a package designed to streamline the automation of laboratory instruments and the orchestration of experimental workflows.

tools.name: PyLabRobot
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware agnostic SDK for lab automation and liquid handling
tools.detailed_description: PyLabRobot is an open-source, hardware-agnostic Python library for controlling laboratory robots, specifically focusing on liquid handling systems, enabling reproducible and flexible lab automation.

tools.name: PyMoDAQ
tools.one_line_profile: Modular Data Acquisition framework for experimental setups
tools.detailed_description: PyMoDAQ (Python Modular Data Acquisition) is a framework designed to interface with various laboratory instruments for data acquisition and experiment control, featuring a modular plugin architecture.

tools.name: pymodaq_femto
tools.one_line_profile: PyMoDAQ extension for femtosecond laser pulse characterization
tools.detailed_description: A specialized extension for the PyMoDAQ framework focused on the characterization and measurement of femtosecond laser pulses in optical experiments.

tools.name: pymodaq_gui
tools.one_line_profile: GUI components for the PyMoDAQ data acquisition ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: Provides the graphical user interface widgets and components used by PyMoDAQ to create interactive dashboards for instrument control and data visualization.

tools.name: pymodaq_plugin_manager
tools.one_line_profile: Plugin manager for the PyMoDAQ ecosystem
tools.detailed_description: A utility tool to manage, install, and list hardware plugins for the PyMoDAQ framework, facilitating the integration of new instruments.

tools.name: quacc
tools.one_line_profile: Platform for computational materials science and quantum chemistry workflows
tools.detailed_description: quacc is a flexible workflow platform for running computational materials science and quantum chemistry calculations, built on top of ASE and Pymatgen, designed for high-throughput computing.

tools.name: AgentLaboratory
tools.one_line_profile: Autonomous research workflow agent
tools.detailed_description: Agent Laboratory is an end-to-end autonomous research workflow system that uses LLMs to assist researchers in planning, executing, and analyzing experiments.

tools.name: LeeQ
tools.one_line_profile: Pulse sequence orchestration for quantum computing experiments
tools.detailed_description: LeeQ is a Python package designed to orchestrate and control pulse sequences for quantum computing experiments, providing an easy-to-use syntax for experimentalists.

tools.name: BlueSky
tools.one_line_profile: Open source air traffic simulator for research
tools.detailed_description: BlueSky is an open-source air traffic simulator designed for research into air traffic management and guidance, allowing for the simulation of traffic flows and control algorithms.

tools.name: SEML
tools.one_line_profile: Slurm Experiment Management Library
tools.detailed_description: SEML is a tool for managing and tracking machine learning and scientific computing experiments on Slurm-based High Performance Computing (HPC) clusters.

tools.name: rapid-earthquake-dynamics
tools.one_line_profile: Automated generation of dynamic earthquake rupture scenarios
tools.detailed_description: A tool for the automated generation of dynamic rupture scenarios based on earthquake kinematic models, facilitating rapid source characterization in seismology.

tools.name: EOS (Experiment Orchestration System)
tools.one_line_profile: Comprehensive software framework and runtime for laboratory automation and experiment orchestration
tools.detailed_description: The Experiment Orchestration System (EOS) is a framework designed to automate laboratory experiments. It manages the execution of experimental protocols, integrates with hardware, and handles data flow, enabling autonomous or semi-autonomous scientific experimentation.

tools.name: Galaxy Workflow for Genomic Analysis
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Galaxy workflow for complete characterization of bacterial genomes
tools.detailed_description: A structured workflow designed for the Galaxy platform to perform automated genomic analysis. It handles tasks such as assembly, annotation, and characterization of bacterial genomes, streamlining the bioinformatics pipeline for microbiologists.

tools.name: MatAgent
tools.one_line_profile: Physics-aware multi-agent LLM framework for material science discovery
tools.detailed_description: A framework leveraging Large Language Models (LLMs) in a multi-agent setup to accelerate material science discovery and optimization. It integrates physics-aware reasoning to guide the generation and evaluation of potential material candidates.

tools.name: ProtTrans
tools.one_line_profile: State-of-the-art pretrained language models for protein sequence analysis
tools.detailed_description: ProtTrans provides a collection of transformer-based language models (like ProtBert, ProtT5) trained on massive protein sequence databases. These models generate embeddings used for various downstream tasks in biology, such as structure prediction, function prediction, and interaction analysis.

tools.name: Coupling ABAQUS MATLAB
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for Software-in-the-Loop coupling of ABAQUS and MATLAB
tools.detailed_description: A framework enabling the interconnection of Finite Element Analysis (FEA) packages (specifically ABAQUS) with MATLAB. It facilitates closed-loop simulations where MATLAB controls the FEA parameters, useful for structural optimization, vibration control, and multi-physical simulations.

tools.name: aimmd
tools.one_line_profile: AI for Molecular Mechanism Discovery in molecular dynamics
tools.detailed_description: aimmd is a tool that autonomously steers molecular dynamics simulations to efficiently sample and understand rare transition events. It uses AI to guide the simulation towards states of interest, enhancing the exploration of molecular mechanisms.

tools.name: BioAgents
tools.one_line_profile: AI scientist framework for autonomous biological research
tools.detailed_description: A multi-agent AI framework designed to automate deep research in biological sciences. It combines literature analysis agents with data scientist agents to perform iterative scientific discovery, hypothesis generation, and data analysis.

tools.name: Bluesky
tools.one_line_profile: Experiment orchestration and data acquisition system for science
tools.detailed_description: Bluesky is a library for experiment orchestration and data acquisition. It provides a high-level interface for controlling hardware, sequencing experiments, and collecting data, widely used in synchrotrons and beamlines (e.g., NSLS-II).

tools.name: Ophyd
tools.one_line_profile: Hardware abstraction library for experimental equipment
tools.detailed_description: Ophyd is a hardware abstraction library that provides a consistent interface for experimental hardware (motors, detectors, etc.) in Python. It is a core component of the Bluesky ecosystem, often used to interface with EPICS control systems.

tools.name: Ophyd Async
tools.one_line_profile: Asynchronous hardware abstraction for Bluesky
tools.detailed_description: A modern implementation of the Ophyd hardware abstraction layer using Python's asyncio. It is designed to provide non-blocking hardware control for the Bluesky data acquisition system, improving performance and responsiveness in complex experimental setups.

tools.name: ChemoSpec
tools.one_line_profile: Chemometric analysis toolkit for spectroscopic data
tools.detailed_description: A collection of R functions for top-down exploratory data analysis of spectral data, including NMR, FTIR, Raman, IR, and UV-Vis spectra. It supports data plotting, PCA, HCA, and other chemometric methods.

tools.name: S4ACS
tools.one_line_profile: Acquisition Control System for SPARC4 instrument
tools.detailed_description: A LabVIEW-based software system for controlling scientific cameras and data acquisition for the SPARC4 instrument at Laboratório Nacional de Astrofísica.

tools.name: CARBS
tools.one_line_profile: Command and control for autonomous swarms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for Command, Control, and Information (C2I) of Autonomous Random Finite Set (RFS) based swarms, developed by LAGER at University of Alabama.

tools.name: GASUR
tools.one_line_profile: Guidance, navigation, and control for autonomous swarms
tools.detailed_description: A Python package for Guidance, Navigation, and Control (GNC) of Autonomous Swarms Using Random Finite Sets (RFS), developed by LAGER at University of Alabama.

tools.name: Bacting
tools.one_line_profile: Scriptable platform for chemo- and bioinformatics
tools.detailed_description: An open-source platform based on Bioclipse that provides a toolkit-independent, scriptable solution to handle data from the life sciences, supporting chemoinformatics and bioinformatics tasks.

tools.name: ClosedLoop
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for building a closed loop neurofeedback system
tools.detailed_description: A framework designed for building closed-loop neurofeedback systems, enabling real-time processing and feedback for neuroscience experiments.

tools.name: helao-pub
tools.one_line_profile: Hierarchical automation platform for natural sciences
tools.detailed_description: A software platform for the hierarchical automation of natural sciences, specifically designed for orchestrating experimental synthesis and characterization.

tools.name: nuclei.io
tools.one_line_profile: Human-in-the-loop active learning framework for pathology image analysis
tools.detailed_description: A web-based framework for human-in-the-loop active learning, specifically tailored for pathology image analysis and segmentation tasks.

tools.name: HexSimInstrument
tools.one_line_profile: Instrument control for HexSIM microscopy system
tools.detailed_description: Instrument control software for the HexSIM system, built on the ScopeFoundry framework, enabling hardware control for structured illumination microscopy.

tools.name: Kosmos
tools.one_line_profile: AI Scientist agent for autonomous discovery
tools.detailed_description: An implementation of an AI Scientist agent for autonomous discovery, designed to be driven by LLMs (e.g., Claude) to perform scientific reasoning and planning.

tools.name: novel-materials-screening
tools.one_line_profile: Workflow for screening novel materials for autonomous synthesis
tools.detailed_description: A computational workflow for screening the Materials Project database to identify novel materials suitable for synthesis by the A-Lab (Autonomous Laboratory).

tools.name: Contrast
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight data acquisition framework for beamline experiment orchestration
tools.detailed_description: A lightweight Python framework designed for orchestrating beamline experiments and data acquisition at MAX IV Laboratory. It provides a flexible way to sequence and control hardware for synchrotron radiation experiments.

tools.name: NICOS
tools.one_line_profile: Networked Instrument Control System for neutron scattering experiments
tools.detailed_description: A control system software used for controlling neutron scattering instruments. It handles hardware communication, experiment sequencing, and data recording, primarily developed at MLZ (Heinz Maier-Leibnitz Zentrum).

tools.name: DeepStrain
tools.one_line_profile: Deep learning workflow for automated characterization of cardiac mechanics
tools.detailed_description: A deep learning-based workflow designed to automate the characterization of cardiac mechanics from medical imaging data, facilitating the analysis of heart strain and function.

tools.name: BatteryModeling
tools.one_line_profile: 2D chemo-electro-mechanical phase field simulations for battery electrodes
tools.detailed_description: A C++ simulation code for performing 2D chemo-electro-mechanical phase field simulations of battery electrode particles, aiding in the understanding of material degradation and performance.

tools.name: Skeletor
tools.one_line_profile: Lightweight module for machine learning experiment orchestration
tools.detailed_description: A minimal Python module designed to orchestrate machine learning experiments, handling configuration management, logging, and experiment tracking to streamline the research workflow.

tools.name: PCDS Devices
tools.one_line_profile: Ophyd device subclasses for LCLS PCDS instrument control
tools.detailed_description: A collection of Ophyd device subclasses tailored for the Photon Controls and Data Systems (PCDS) at the Linac Coherent Light Source (LCLS). It provides hardware abstraction for controlling beamline devices in Python.

tools.name: Typhos
tools.one_line_profile: Automatic GUI generation for Ophyd devices in experiments
tools.detailed_description: A tool that automatically generates PyDM-based Graphical User Interfaces (GUIs) for Ophyd devices. It is used in experimental control systems to provide user-friendly interfaces for hardware interaction without manual coding.

tools.name: PyTorch Active Learning
tools.one_line_profile: Active learning library for human-in-the-loop machine learning
tools.detailed_description: A PyTorch-based library implementing active learning strategies, designed to optimize data annotation and model training processes. It is widely used in creating efficient machine learning workflows for scientific data.

tools.name: AutoDMRI
tools.one_line_profile: Automated characterization of noise distributions in diffusion MRI
tools.detailed_description: A Python tool for the automated characterization of noise distributions in diffusion MRI data. It helps in denoising and improving the quality of MRI analysis pipelines.

tools.name: Firewheel
tools.one_line_profile: Orchestration tool for distributed network system experiments
tools.detailed_description: An experiment orchestration tool developed by Sandia National Laboratories for building and controlling repeatable experiments of distributed network systems at scale. It facilitates rigorous testing and validation in network science research.

tools.name: OpenAlpha_Evolve
tools.one_line_profile: Framework for autonomous coding agents and evolutionary algorithms
tools.detailed_description: An open-source Python framework inspired by AlphaEvolve, designed for research in autonomous coding agents and evolutionary algorithms. It provides a platform for developing and testing self-evolving code and agents.

tools.name: Self-Driving Lab Demo
tools.one_line_profile: Software stack for autonomous experimentation demos
tools.detailed_description: A software platform and instruction set for setting up and running self-driving labs (autonomous experimentation), integrating hardware control (LEDs, spectrophotometers) with adaptive design algorithms.

tools.name: ARES (RAG)
tools.one_line_profile: Automated Evaluation of RAG Systems
tools.detailed_description: A framework for automatically evaluating Retrieval-Augmented Generation (RAG) systems, focusing on context relevance, answer faithfulness, and answer relevance using synthetic data.

tools.name: Summit
tools.one_line_profile: Machine learning based chemical reaction optimization
tools.detailed_description: A package for optimizing chemical reactions using machine learning, providing tools for reaction benchmarking and closed-loop optimization strategies.

tools.name: ARES (Adversarial)
tools.one_line_profile: Adversarial Robustness Evaluation for Safety
tools.detailed_description: A Python library for adversarial machine learning, focusing on benchmarking the adversarial robustness of image classification models against various attacks.

tools.name: MED
tools.one_line_profile: Micro to Macro Equation Discovery
tools.detailed_description: A framework for autonomously driving equation discovery from data, capable of scaling from laptops to supercomputers, developed by the Positron Imaging Centre.

tools.name: AFL-agent
tools.one_line_profile: AI agent for Autonomous Formulation Laboratory
tools.detailed_description: An AI agent implementation designed for the Autonomous Formulation Laboratory (AFL) at NIST, facilitating automated materials formulation experiments.

tools.name: MCP-Zero
tools.one_line_profile: Active Tool Discovery for Autonomous LLM Agents
tools.detailed_description: A framework enabling autonomous LLM agents to actively discover and learn to use tools, relevant for building autonomous scientific agents.
